text:
="preserve">Pavlova is a sweet dessert made of meringue. It is named after Russian ballet dancer Anna Pavlova, after she went. It is crisp on the outside and light on the inside, and is usually topped with fruit and whipped cream.
Pavlova is popular in Australia and New Zealand. It was supposedly named after Anna Pavlova following a tour she made to Australia and New Zealand in the 1920s. It is eaten a lot in these countries during the summertime, including over the Christmas period. However, it can be eaten all the year round.
